item.title: This Pokemon Meets Fall Guys Game Was Saved After Wizards Of The Coast Cancelled It
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

In February 2023, Wizards of the Coast closed an internal game development studio, and with it cancelled multiple unannounced titles, one of them being Whimpact!, a "Pokemon meets Fall Guys" online multiplayer game. Rather than let it die, Leah Hoyer, who was at the time VP of creative for WotC, opened her own studio called Level Headed Games, acquired the rights to Whimpact!, and continued development--and it's set to release in early access soon.

Whimpact! drops players into the world of Whims, cute little creatures that pass along magical powers to those who collect and care for them. The more they're cared for, the stronger those powers will be. Up to eight players will be able to join together in co-op arena-style gameplay as they collect Whims, gather mystical energy called Starcane, and navigate obstacles while fighting hordes of robotic invaders trying to steal the energy for themselves.

There are seven different types of Whims to collect, each with six different color variants. The power each Whim gives the player will depend on its color, with powers including increased speed, increased strength, high jumping ability, longer jumping ability, and more. Players will be able to mix and match powers, including swapping Whims on the fly, during a match as well.

Both the player characters and the Whims can also be customized with cosmetics including clothing, weapon skins, and the ability to decorate a home base for their characters called a Home Tile. The debut trailer gives us a look at some of the items players will be able to equip, including clothes, hats, and a watermelon sword.

No official release window has been announced for Whimpact! as of this writing, but the game will launch on PC in early access when it does become available.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Yarnhub Studios Debuts Look at Gameplay For Realistic F2P WWII Shooter, Brass Rain
item.content:encoded:
Brass Rain is an upcoming free-to-play WWII first-person shooter from Yarnhub Studios, a developer made up of veterans from EA, Remedy, Sony, and Jagex. It's also a studio that's known more as an animation studio, making animated videos shared on YouTube, that is now entering the video game industry with Brass Rain as its debut title.

It's able to fund the title thanks to $2.9 million of crowdfunding from the community it built with its YouTube channel, which currently has over 2.7 million subscribers. While it's been known as an animation studio, making a game has been a long time coming, and something that the studio's community has been asking the company to try for a long time.

"Our audience has been asking for us to make a game for years," said David Webb, chief executive officer at Yarnhub, in a press release. "They've told us exactly what they want: a game with heart, historical authenticity, global campaigns, and multiplayer combat that lets them fight as infantry, tank crews, bomber gunners, and naval teams. Brass Rain is our answer to that call, built from the ground up with the community in mind."

"Brass Rain isn't just a game, it's a living historical experience shaped by the millions who watch our films every month," continued Cyril Barrow, head of games at Yarnhub Studios. "Our community challenged us to go beyond what games like War Thunder and World of Tanks offer, by adding the one thing they've always wanted: boots-on-the-ground infantry. We're delivering a fully crew-based combat experience that lets players fight together across land, sea, and air, and experience history as they go."

According to the press release, Yarnhub is moving forward with a free-to-play model because of its success on YouTube and the crowdfunding it has accomplished so far. There will be "some of the lowest-cost cosmetic microtransactions in gaming" included in its free-to-play model, according to the studio. We'll have to get price matches on that claim to see if it holds water, but for now, it's nice to see Yarnhub at least trying to approach free-to-play in a way that won't try to gauge players.

Brass Rain will launch in early access on Steam sometime in 2026.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/yarnhub-studios-brass-rain-debut-gameplay-trailer-wwi-f2p/

item.title: MacBook Pro (M4 Pro Chip, 512GB) Hits New Record Low, Apple Clears Stock as M5 Chip Arrives
item.content:encoded:
Apple just announced its M5 chip a few weeks ago but this MacBook Pro with M4 Pro remains an incredibly powerful machine that handles almost all professional workflows with ease. This record low pricing at $1,749 on Amazon for the 24GB/512GB model, down from $1,999, makes it more compelling than most MacBooks currently available.

The model sits as the #1 best-seller among MacBook Pros on Amazon and the reason becomes clear when you consider the specs at this price point. Apple never runs discounts directly on its website or in its retail stores, so hitting up retailers like Amazon during Black Friday is the only way to score legitimate discounts on current-generation MacBooks.

See at Amazon

Desktop-Class Performance

The 12-core CPU splits down into eight performance cores and four efficiency cores and makes quick work of everything from video editing to the compilation of software. The architecture executes the resource-intensive tasks much faster compared to the previous M3 Pro, drawing less power in the process, which puts more runtime on your battery when doing intensive work. Real-world performance reveals stutter-free 4K video timeline scrubbing, instant photo filter application across hundreds of images, and code compilation that completes before you finish your coffee.

The 16-core GPU provides graphics performance that’s competitive with discrete graphics in much pricier Windows laptops. You can edit multi-layer 8K video projects, work with intricate 3D models, or run demanding creative apps like Cinema 4D without thermal throttling. Gaming performance is above expectations for a Mac, with AAA titles running at high settings and maintaining smooth frame rates. A unified memory architecture sees the GPU tapping into the same 24GB pool as the CPU which diminishes bottlenecks normally associated with traditional discrete graphics arrangements.

The 24GB of unified memory handles professional workloads that choke systems with less RAM. You can have dozens of browser tabs open, run multiple creative applications at the same time, and switch between projects without any hint of slowdowns. The unified architecture means this 24GB functions more efficiently than traditional RAM since both CPU and GPU access it directly.

The display on the 14.2-inch Liquid Retina XDR is capable of 1000 nits of sustained brightness and peaks at 1600 nits for HDR content. Mini-LED backlighting enables true blacks with excellent contrast that makes on-screen content pop. Color accuracy meets professional levels right out of the box, thanks to P3 wide color gamut coverage that will satisfy even photographers and video editors. The screen refresh rate of 120Hz courtesy of ProMotion makes scrolling feel butter-smooth and helps alleviate eye strain during extended work sessions.

That’s also 18 hours of video playback or about 12 hours of actual work mixing web browsing, document editing, and creative applications. You can work through a full day without hunting for outlets, and that transforms the way you approach mobile productivity. The MagSafe charging connection means that accidental cable yanks won’t send your laptop flying, and you still have both Thunderbolt ports free for peripherals.

Apple Intelligence integration brings AI features right to the operating system, from advanced text editing suggestions all the way to picture generation tools within native apps. All of these AI-related tasks are processed locally by the M4 Pro’s Neural Engine for data privacy and speed. These features keep evolving through new software updates, adding value during the life of the laptop.

You’re getting here a professional-grade laptop with M4 Pro performance for $250 less than Apple’s direct pricing, at $1,749. Similar Windows laptops are $2,500 or more and lack the efficiency and battery life that Apple Silicon delivers.

See at Amazon
